New Records: England's best bowling performance in T20 World Cup with Oman being bowled out for 47
England chased the target in just 19 balls, setting a World Cup record
Key Match Events: England won the match by 8 wickets
Adil Rashid took 4-11 with mesmerizing leg-spin
Jofra Archer and Mark Wood both picked up 3 wickets each
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler emphasized the importance of strong bowling performance and positive approach during the chase
Oman captain Aqib Ilyas acknowledged the pressure on their batters playing against a top side and the need for improvement
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's next assignment is against Namibia at 18:00 BST on Saturday
England's NRR goes to 3.081, better than Scotland's 2.16
Others: The match was played at Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, North Sound, Antigua
Steven Finn and Henry Moeran provided commentary for the match on BBC Sounds
